reviewText: A unique new idea in the Mafia crime-movie. Four women, stripped of their manfolk start a vendetta of their own. The female in the crimestory seems finally to have come of age. Good acting by al the leads, especially  Kinski, Redgrave and Tilly and an original story premise more then make up  for some weak area's ( A series of rather unlikely coincidences making a  twist in the family relations possible, and a villain who switches a little  too easily from a halfwit-psycho to a charming young man and the other way  round.) A must for all the fans of Godfather.
summary: A new outlook on the Godfather-formula.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is exactly what a "mob movie" should be. Most notable is the performance by James Marsden, a gifted young actor with matinee idol good looks. His performance was worthy of an Emmy nomination. Why this film is not on US DVD yet is a mystery to me, considering the popularity of "gangster" films. I really had trouble believing Vanessa Redgrave as an Italian, but hey, she's Vanessa Redgrave, and I don't question her acting ability! This film is riviting and should please the Godfather fans and fans in general of crime dramas.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have the original complete mini series on VHS. This aired as a mini series on television from the producer of "The Last Don". I see that the DVD version is only 117 minutes but the VHS boxset has two video tapes, part 1.) 95 minutes and part 2.) 85 minutes totatling 180 minutes equaling 3 hours viewing time. That is 1/3 of the movie cut from the original movie. I wish the original version could be made to DVD so we could enjoy the movie in the format as it was intended.

reviewText: I must say that this movie is just okay. When I first saw it on tv 3 years ago, I thought that it was a really good movie-but then I only saw part 2 of the series and missed the first half. I bought this on dvd and thought I was lucky because it's very rare to be on a dvd, but when watching the movie you then realize it's just simply OKAY. First let me tell you. The version on the dvd is kind of different from the one that came on tv because they changed some of the scenes like when the mafia wives meet the villain, Luka, for time and when they were suppose to go to some casino place where the idiot killed this guy. All of that was on the tv and not the dvd, itself. What was corny was you get to the murder scene when Luka kills the Luciano men-that was really weak and stupid. He kills the children first and no one hears?!!!!!!!!!!!! Then he goes downstairs when they're having dinner then the next scene they are all just laying there on the floor?!!!!!!!!Why didn't anyone hear the gun shots?! What is likeable in the movie is the bonding and loyalty between the mob widows-now, that I really liked. (I must say that guy that played Luka, James Marsden, is one fine white dude! Very fine for a white guy-oh, my goodness! I don't like white guys cause those aren't my kind, but I just had to say how fine he is, though that's irrelevant.) So, I hope my review was helpful.

reviewText: I absolutely love the movie "Bella Mafia"! Being a huge fan of mafia and gangster movies, it was extremely refreshing to watch one that was centered around the women in a powerful family rather than just the men. Don't get me wrong, the men do play a powerful role in the film, but it is the strength and intelligence of the women that brings the family justice and respect.I don't want to give away any of the story, but anyone who loves mafia films would love this! I HIGHLY recommend this film!

reviewText: Bella Mafia ( 1997 ) featuring the legendary Franco Nero andNastassja Kinski,  coupled with a litany of almost equally rabidcharismatic actors, such as  Jennifer Tilly, Debbis Farina, andJames Marsden, is definitely worth a rental or purchase!The strong point of the movie concerns the rivalry between 2Sicilian clans, in particular the natural struggle between them.and the conflicts in how they interpret and process rules,regulations (mores, norms, if you will) stemming from traditionshanded down over centuries over many generations surroundingrelations between people, and the black sheep in a family, etc.Another strength, is the dramatic nature of the story, a few timescoming close to over-reaching, (but never reaching that point) fromthe extreme behavior seen at various points and at several times inthe story, such as rubouts, the methods, the bloodlineintermarriages, business negotiations.The filming is flawless, the charisma of the casting spotless...impressive.On the other hand, admittedly, there is a quick pace in the storydevelopment, at times complex to follow.Alos, perhaps more music could have been added, and a more roundedstoryline at times, to make it more palatable to a larger audience,could have been the case.Overall, definitely a keeper for those with even a modest interestin dramatic, underworld movies. In other words, a classic.
summary: Legendary actors,  dramatic, intrictate power rivalry, impressive
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love Vanessa Redgrave, so I'd watch anything she is in, which got me to this made for TV mini-series.  This imported DVD version is the only available version. (There was a video edition...).  The DVD looks and sounds great, and the film is highly entertaining, but it is odd that with the popularity of Mob films, and the star power in this one, that no American studio has issued the complete version....This one is missing about 35 minutes....

reviewText: I have this on VHS. I love it. When I'm feeling like I need some sort of vindication for something, I like to put this on and it makes me go, "Yeah!' If women ruled...well...let's just say the Godmother would have done it both the same and differently. And I doubt her empire would have fallen apart! Dinner anyone?Please release this IN ORIGINAL, UNEDITED REGION 1 FORMAT. PLEASE! We need it. And we will buy it.
summary: A fun and serious chick revenge flick

reviewText: ...I love Mafia/Gangster flicks. This is kinda like "Valley of the Donnas" or "Mitzi's Honor". One disturbed character makes this a little more than a soap opera and I was a little surprised that this was able to be shown on network television. Do not look for any of the poetry or lyricism of any of the Godfather moovys in this one. Nope. This is strictly a Sat. afternoon popcorner.
